author: parithosh
content:
The issue with starting a new testnet from scratch is finding people to run it reliably. Client teams already have enough on their plate and running another testnet the size of prater is both economically and logistically unfeasible. Deprecating goerli would take too long, a lot of orgs just moved to goerli now after ropsten was deprecated. It'd be unfair to ask them to move again so quickly, besides it'll take a while for the ecosystem (rpc, explorers, etc) to catch up. 

We can launch a new beaconchain on sepolia for e.g, one that isn't permissioned. But if we have x stakers join in and abandon their setup soon after, we'll quickly have an unusable setup. The solutions would have to be on the lines of: guaranteed exiting or somehow performing a re-genesis every few months. 

I guess going back to https://github.com/eth-clients/goerli/issues/97 and seeing how we can inflate the supply might be the easiest path forward :/
